alert.note: Alert for Coos (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 18 at 3:27AM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 915 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of Maine, including the following counties, Franklin, Oxford and Somerset. Portions of northern New Hampshire, including the following county, Coos. * WHEN...Until 915 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. River or stream flows are elevated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 326 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Bethel, Eustis, Rangeley, Rumford, Kingfield, Andover, Carrabassett Valley, Errol, Weld and Phillips.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
